name: Orbswallow
tagline: Mossling village in the deep fungal forest of Mulchgrove
description: A community in the seldom-trod fungal forest of Mulchgrove, clustered around a pair of gargantuan toadstools and three magical trees. Lush moss covers every surface not occupied by giant, garish fungus.
atmosphere: Deep fungal forest with lush moss and giant, garish fungus
inhabitants_description: Mosslings. No humans or folk of other Kindreds dwell here.

governance.ruling_body: Chief Mulcher selected every seven years by oracular process
governance.notes: House Guillefer pays no attention whatsoever to the village of mosslings

religion.religious_practices: Worship Blosquom that manifests in their fungal shrine. Also journey into fungal forest to seek guidance of mould oracle Gropoll in her hidden grotto dedicated to clay-god Mbombre
religion.notes: Nominally followers of Pluritine Church as subjects of the duke. Unbeknown to folk, Blosquom is an aspect of the Myconom

history: Centre of Mossling Culture - heart of mossling culture lies in Orbswallow
Built around three great and venerable trees with unique magical properties
Folk divided into three clans dedicated to tending the trees
current_events: Ongoing and escalating conflict with nutcaps who launch aerial raids to snatch fruits of the three trees
Breeding programmes attempted to protect against loss of trees, though none entirely successful to date

special_features.name: The Three Trees
special_features.description: Milktree, Moontree, and Pipetree with unique magical properties on whose fruits the village's livelihood depends
special_features.mechanical_effect: Loss of one tree would bring calamity to village

special_features.name: Three Clans System
special_features.description: Pipers (hasty and headstrong), Milkers (gullible and guileless), and Waxers (fickle and sly)

equipment_availability.notes: Only rustic weapons (arrows, daggers, shortbows, slings, staves) available. Special produce of three trees can be bought.

locations.name: The Milktree
locations.description: Broad, bulbous, and oak-like tree festooned with pendulous, orb-shaped fruits bearing remarkable resemblance to mammalian teats
locations.exterior: Low-hanging fruits filled with sweet, nourishing milk or yoghurt, upper branches filled with cheese
locations.atmosphere: Cosy wicker spheres with napping mosslings among branches
special_features: Forms significant part of village's food

locations.name: The Pipetree
locations.description: Sprawling and multi-limbed, with maple-like leaves, bears long, hollow, dry-husked fruits
locations.exterior: Husks harvested and crafted into several kinds of pipes
special_features: Fruits used for pipes sold for export

locations.name: The Moontree
locations.description: Tall, elegant, and birch-like, bears fruits of several different kinds hanging in clusters high among delicate, silver limbs
locations.exterior: Fruit characteristics resemble phases of moon, used as food, pigmentation, tools, oils, and lighting
special_features: Fruits resemble moon phases with various uses

locations.name: Sapling Grove
locations.description: A sheltered grove of experimental saplings—cuttings and cross-breedings of the three trees
special_features: Cuttings invariably perish after a decade, never bearing fruit

locations.name: Milkers' Huts
locations.description: Squat huts, built of wicker and slimy mud, huddled around the base of the Milktree
locations.interior: Home-fromageries where specialty cheeses are made
locations.populace: Five mossling families of the Milkers clan

services.name: Old Shuck cheese
services.notes: Mild and creamy to mossling tastes

services.name: Hogger cheese
services.description: Wrinkled and covered in fuzzy green mould
services.notes: 10% chance per complete round of increasing Constitution by 1, induces mossy green chest hair growth

services.name: Buggler-boot cheese
services.description: Grotesquely slimy with hairy blue strands, sold in sock-like leather pouches
services.notes: 3-in-6 chance of healing 1 HP per pouch, non-mosslings can only consume one per day

locations.name: Old Thromby
locations.description: A giant toadstool which houses six mossling families of the Pipers clan
locations.interior: Chambers dug out of the toadstool's flesh
locations.exterior: Houses perched precariously upon its dome
locations.populace: Six mossling families of Pipers clan

services.name: Smokepipes
services.description: Gourd-like fruits with stem, mouthpiece, and bowl for smoking pipeleaf

services.name: Windpipes
services.description: Long, reedy fruits that produce whistling tones soothing to livestock

services.name: Dancepipes
services.description: Thick, pot-bellied, woody fruits bored with holes as musical instrument

locations.name: Waxers' Rock
locations.description: A natural rock formation that houses seven mossling families of the Waxers clan
locations.interior: Rooms carved out of the rock
locations.exterior: Hog enclosures at the feet of the rock producing cacophony of snorting and oinking
locations.populace: Seven mossling families of Waxers clan

services.name: New moon fruits
services.description: Succulent black orbs filled with sweet, nourishing, midnight-black juice
services.notes: Each fruit treated as day's rations, juice can be used as pigment

services.name: Crescent fruits
services.description: Golden, sickle-shaped shards with strength of steel
services.notes: Used as cutting, carving, digging tools or weapon (treat as dagger)

services.name: Waxing fruits
services.description: Near-hemispheres of soft, yellow, fatty tissue
services.notes: Valued for lubricative and preservative properties

services.name: Gibbous fruits
services.description: Bulbous spheroids of yellow, green-veined flesh with nectar-like flavour
services.notes: Each fruit treated as day's rations

services.name: Full moon fruits
services.description: Perfect, milk-white spheres 1′ in diameter that give off warm, creamy glow
services.notes: 20′ diameter glow, subsides after 1 week once picked

locations.name: Compost Heap
locations.description: A steaming mound of decomposing vegetable matter and mossling dung
locations.exterior: Stench almost unbearable to humans, mosslings savour the aroma
special_features: Toilet platform hangs over heap from top of Waxers' Rock
secrets: Several decomposing mossling corpses can be found - mosslings bring their dead here to decompose into mould

locations.name: The Sombre Lamb
locations.description: A giant toadstool housing the village's tavern and brewery
locations.interior: Porous, smoke-stained walls of spongy mushroom flesh. Crowded with quirky wooden stools, tables, and log benches. Illuminated by pale, creamy glow of full moon fruits on rickety shelves among skulls and artistic wood.
locations.exterior: Wooden sign: 'The Sombre Lamb—Folk of All Clans Welcome'
locations.populace: At night jam-packed with local mosslings, merrily drinking and smoking. Travellers rare and treated politely until all inebriated.

services.name: Black new moon soup
services.description: Spiced with pine sap, stains tongue and teeth for days

services.name: Moon's Milk
services.description: Brewed in mycelial cellars beneath inn

services.name: Glubwob
services.description: Brewed in mycelial cellars beneath inn

locations.name: The Weaning Arch
locations.description: A stone arch of apparently natural origin, completely overgrown with brambles, ivy, and wild roses
special_features: Used for various rites of passage where initiates are bathed in hog-cream
secrets: Clearing brambles reveals graven bands of magical script describing ritual to summon fire spirits. Ritual requires rare woods worth 250gp and releases fire elemental that must be controlled with Save Versus Spell

locations.name: Fungal Shrine
locations.description: A tall, white mushroom in the dank forest just outside village, swaying gently as if in a breeze
locations.interior: Little niches carved into stem occupied by offerings
special_features: Offerings include gourds carved with silly faces, cheese rounds, hog blubber strips, all riddled with white mould
secrets: Consuming mouldy offerings requires Save Versus Doom or enter psychedelic trance for 1d8 hours with 1 HP damage per hour, survivors gain cryptic clue. Characters with Wisdom 13+ trigger manifestation of Blosquom

locations.name: Mulcher's Path
locations.description: A narrow, twisting track partially overgrown with bracken and fungal patches
locations.exterior: Overgrown path leading west to Horse-Eye Road

locations.name: Blacke Road
locations.description: An old cart road, now seldom used and almost disappeared in the mycelial undergrowth of the fungal forests
locations.exterior: Overgrown cart road leading east to Blackeswell

npcs.name: Brimbul
npcs.title: Chief Mulcher of Orbswallow
npcs.description: A squashed-looking, middle-aged mossling woman, with tiny black eyes, matted, root-like hair, and a long, floppy nose that looks like a limp parsnip
npcs.dress: Lives among each of the three clans on rotating basis
desires: The expulsion of all nutcaps from the surrounding woods (her husband was slain by them while defending the three trees)
The secret alchemical recipe to combine the essences of the three trees, producing an elixir of eternal life
secrets: Unaware that nutcaps already know how to create the elixir, though its powers are not what she imagines
Possesses prismatic crystal Talisman of Spell Reflection but unaware of its magic

npcs.name: Phrobe
npcs.title: Sombre Lamb Proprietor
npcs.description: A rotund mossling man, hunched over with age, with bulbous black eyes, a broad toothless grin, and straggling, white mycelial hair
npcs.dress: Mould-riddled woollens and a floppy hog-skin cap
npcs.mannerisms: Mistakes strangers for people he knows
npcs.speech: Constant burbling and cackling. Makes jokes no one else understands. Woldish, Mulch.
desires: To meet the fabled 'Duke of Brackenwoolled' (who he believes is a unicorn of some kind)

npcs.name: Blosquom
npcs.title: Fungal Avatar
npcs.description: A jolly, long-nosed face ringed with tiny, waving hands, manifested in a cloud of greenish mushroom spores
demeanor: Operates on cosmic plane with no conception of worldly matters
desires: Corpses for spore infestation, to further spread the influence of the Myconom throughout Dolmenwood
secrets: Is a manifestation of the Myconom, unknown to the mosslings who worship it

entries.description: A mossling explodes in a puff of slime and spores. This is regarded as a blessing from Blosquom.
1d3 giant mutant snails slither into the village and attack the trees.
An ochre slime-hulk wanders through the village. It ignores mosslings, but attacks others.
3d6 mosslings dance through the village to music played on pot-bellied gourd pipes from the Pipetree.
2d4 nutcaps make an aerial raid on the fruits of one of the three trees (roll 1d3 and consult map key).
Coming of age ceremony: a young mossling is bathed in hog-cream beneath the Weaning Arch.
A mushroom-addled mossling stumbles around, ranting about 'the coming age of the Myconom.'
An adventuring party brings a corpse to the fungal shrine for spore infestation.
2d6 mosslings from an outlying community arrive for a rollicking night out 'on the town.' It is difficult for anyone to get any sleep during the ensuing rumpus.
3d6 mosslings singing and making offerings at the fungal shrine. The smiling face of Blosquom manifests and croons along.
2d4 nutcaps make an aerial raid on the fruits of one of the three trees (roll 1d3 and consult map key).
